intro: Schradera scandens, commonly known as the climbing schradera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its twining stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Schradera scandens is often found growing along forest edges and in disturbed habitats, where it climbs on trees and shrubs.
